title: Paul Edward Dutton was trained at the Pontifical Institute of Mediaeval Studies and is now the Jack and Nancy Farley Chair in History at Simon Fraser University. He is the author of The Politics of Dreaming in the Carolingian Empire (1994) and Charlemagne’s Mustache and Other Cultural Clusters of a Dark Age
With Édouard Jeauneau he wrote, The Autograph of Eriugena (1996) and with Herbert L. Kessler The Poetry and Paintings of the First Bible of Charles the Bald

Wendy Marie Hoofnagle is an Assistant Professor of English at the University of Northern Iowa with research interests in twelfth- and thirteenth-century English and French vernacular literature. She has published several entries in The Late Medieval Age of Crisis and Renewal, 1300–1500: A Biographical Dictionary

note: Since 2001, he has been Robert M. Conway Director of the Medieval Institute at Notre Dame. Noble has authored, coauthored, or edited seven books and has publsihed some thirty articles and chapters dealing with Carolingian and papal history.
